revised_title: Molecular Weight Changes in Polymer Degradation
tldr: The authors study the changes in molecular weight distribution of long-chain polymers when the main chain is subjected to random fracture, such as when exposed to high-energy radiation. They find that after an average of 3 to 8 main-chain fractures per molecule, all trace of the initial distribution curve is lost. The shape of the curve of weight average against degree of degradation can provide information about the initial weight average and molecular weights, allowing for the characterization of the initial molecular-weight distribution.
